problem: Four friends - Amy, Brian, Carla, and David - each decide to bake a cake for the annual Great Cake-Off competition. They each choose from four distinct flavors - chocolate, vanilla, red velvet, and carrot - and must follow specific rules: | Amy never bakes a chocolate cake. | If Brian bakes a red velvet cake, Carla must bake a chocolate cake. | If Carla bakes a vanilla cake, then David must bake a red velvet cake. | David never bakes a carrot cake.

questions.question: If Brian bakes a chocolate cake, which of the following must be true?
options: Carla bakes a red velvet cake.
David bakes a red velvet cake.

questions.question: If Carla bakes a chocolate cake, which of the following could be true?
options: Amy bakes a red velvet cake.

questions.question: Which of the following combinations is NOT possible based on the passage?
options: Amy - Vanilla; Brian - Chocolate; Carla - Red Velvet; David - Red Velvet
Amy - Carrot; Brian - Red Velvet; Carla - Chocolate; David - Vanilla
Amy - Red Velvet; Brian - Vanilla; Carla - Chocolate; David - Vanilla
Amy - Carrot; Brian - Vanilla; Carla - Red Velvet; David - Chocolate

problem: Four friends - Emma, Frank, Grace, and Harry - each decide to play a musical instrument in their new club called The Musical Chairs Club. They each choose from four distinct instruments - guitar, piano, violin, and drums - and must follow specific rules:

questions.question: If Frank plays the piano, which of the following must be true?

Emma - Drums; Frank - Violin; Grace - Piano; Harry - Guitar
Emma - Violin; Frank - Guitar; Grace - Drums; Harry - Piano

problem: Four friends - Isabella, Jack, Kelly, and Leo - each decide to bring a pet to the annual Pet Party Parade. They each choose from four distinct pets - cat, dog, rabbit, and parrot - and must follow specific rules: | Isabella never brings a dog. | If Jack brings a parrot, Kelly must bring a cat. | If Kelly brings a rabbit, then Leo must bring a dog. | Leo never brings a parrot.

questions.question: If Jack brings a rabbit, which of the following must be true?
If Kelly brings a cat, which of the following could be true?

options: Isabella - Cat; Jack - Dog; Kelly - Rabbit; Leo - Dog
Isabella - Parrot; Jack - Rabbit; Kelly - Cat; Leo - Dog
Isabella - Rabbit; Jack - Parrot; Kelly - Cat; Leo - Dog
Isabella - Cat; Jack - Dog; Kelly - Parrot; Leo - Rabbit

problem: Four friends - Monica, Nathan, Olivia, and Peter - each decide to create an artwork for the annual Colorful Art Exhibition. They each choose from four distinct art styles - abstract, impressionist, cubist, and surrealist - and must follow specific rules: | Monica never creates a cubist artwork. | If Nathan creates an impressionist artwork, Olivia must create an abstract artwork. | If Olivia creates a surrealist artwork, then Peter must create an impressionist artwork. | Peter never creates a cubist artwork.

questions.question: If Nathan creates an abstract artwork, which of the following must be true?
If Olivia creates an abstract artwork, which of the following could be true?
Which of the following combinations is NOT possible based on the passage?
options: Monica - Surrealist; Nathan - Abstract; Olivia - Impressionist; Peter - Impressionist
Monica - Abstract; Nathan - Impressionist; Olivia - Abstract; Peter - Surrealist
Monica - Surrealist; Nathan - Abstract; Olivia - Cubist; Peter - Impressionist
Monica - Impressionist; Nathan - Abstract; Olivia - Surrealist; Peter - Cubist

problem: Four friends - Quinn, Rebecca, Steve, and Tina - each decide to design an outfit for the annual Fabulous Fashion Show. They each choose from four distinct styles - casual, formal, sporty, and vintage - and must follow specific rules: | Quinn never designs a sporty outfit. | If Rebecca designs a formal outfit, Steve must design a casual outfit. | If Steve designs a vintage outfit, then Tina must design a sporty outfit. | Tina never designs a formal outfit.

questions.question: If Rebecca designs a casual outfit, which of the following must be true?

Quinn - Formal; Rebecca - Vintage; Steve - Casual; Tina - Sporty
Quinn - Casual; Rebecca - Formal; Steve - Casual; Tina - Vintage

problem: Four friends - Ursula, Victor, Wendy, and Xavier - each decide to create a project for the annual Spectacular Science Fair. They each choose from four distinct scientific fields - biology, chemistry, physics, and astronomy - and must follow specific rules: | Ursula never conducts a chemistry project. | If Victor conducts a physics project, Wendy must conduct a biology project. | If Wendy conducts an astronomy project, then Xavier must conduct a physics project. | Xavier never conducts a biology project.

questions.question: If Victor conducts an astronomy project, which of the following must be true?

Which of the following combinations is NOT possible based on the passage?
options: Ursula - Physics; Victor - Chemistry; Wendy - Astronomy; Xavier - Physics
Ursula - Biology; Victor - Physics; Wendy - Biology; Xavier - Chemistry
Ursula - Astronomy; Victor - Physics; Wendy - Biology; Xavier - Chemistry
Ursula - Physics; Victor - Astronomy; Wendy - Chemistry; Xavier - Biology

questions.question: If Xavier conducts a physics project, which of the following must be true?

Four friends - Yvonne, Zachary, Alice, and Ben - each decide to grow a plant for the annual Grand Garden Gala. They each choose from four distinct plant types - cactus, fern, orchid, and sunflower - and must follow specific rules: | Yvonne never grows a fern. | If Zachary grows an orchid, Alice must grow a cactus. | If Alice grows a sunflower, then Ben must grow an orchid. | Ben never grows a cactus.
If Zachary grows a sunflower, which of the following must be true?
If Alice grows a cactus, which of the following could be true?
Which of the following combinations is NOT possible based on the passage?
options: Yvonne - Orchid; Zachary - Sunflower; Alice - Fern; Ben - Orchid
Yvonne - Cactus; Zachary - Orchid; Alice - Cactus; Ben - Fern
Yvonne - Sunflower; Zachary - Orchid; Alice - Cactus; Ben - Fern
Yvonne - Orchid; Zachary - Fern; Alice - Sunflower; Ben - Orchid

questions.question: If Ben grows an orchid, which of the following must be true?
